name: James Knox
bio:
James Knox (born 14 December 2006 in Brighton, England) is a British eSports racing driver competing in AFO. He drives for his own team, FOX eSports, and is set to contest the full championship in Season 3. 

 Knox previously made an impact ahead of Season 2 by winning the two unofficial test races, demonstrating strong pace and racecraft, but was unable to participate in the season itself due to commitments in other leagues. Returning for Season 3, Knox aims to establish himself as a regular front running competitor in AFO while leading FOX eSports through its campaign.

name: Dan Thyn
bio: Dan Thyn (born in the Czech Republic) is a Czech eSports racing driver competing in AFO. Widely known for his confidence and outspoken personality, Thyn is regarded by himself - and loudly claims to be regarded by others - as the greatest talent to ever touch a sim rig. Backed by Qatari funding since the early stages of his racing career, this support provided the financial foundation that allowed him to progress rapidly through the ranks and compete at the highest level. Entering the championship surrounded by controversy, Thyn has built a reputation as one of the most polarising figures on the grid. While his pace and results demand attention, his attitude has made him unpopular among many competitors. As he continues his AFO campaign, Thyn aims to convert notoriety into dominance and prove that his reputation is justified on track.

name: Auge Rimkunas
bio: Auge Rimkunas competes for Out For Blood in AFO Season 3.
